snippet: In a letter to a federal judge, the Justice Department said it still required help despite its success in gaining iPhone data in a separate case.
abstract: Prosecutors tell Federal Court Judge James Orenstein in Brooklyn that Justice Dept still needs assistance in getting Apple's help to unlock iPhone belonging to drug dealer Jun Feng; previous ruling rejected demand for Apple's cooperation; Justice Dept calls it routine request, but Apple contends it would create precedent to unlock many other encrypted phones.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and KATIE BENNER
byline.contributor: Eric Lichtblau reported from Washington and Katie Benner from New York.

lead_paragraph: In a letter to a federal judge, the Justice Department said it still required help despite its success in gaining iPhone data in a separate case.

headline.main: U.S. Presses Bid to Force Apple to Unlock iPhone in New York
headline.print_headline: New Push  to Unlock  an iPhone in Brooklyn
